document.masterDocTitle: On the validity of some species names of South American longhorn beetles (Coleoptera, Cerambycidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the validity of some species names of South American longhorn beetles (Coleoptera, Cerambycidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality
. Brazil , Rio de Janeiro. ( OXUM ; examined). Distribution — Brazil (Goiás, Minas Gerais to Rio Grande do Sul), Bolivia (Santa Cruz), Paraguay , Argentina (Misiones).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality
— Brazil . ( BMNH ; not examined).

The comparison between the holotype of
Trichophorus variatus
Newman, 1841
and one of the three syntypes of
Elaphidion elegans
Chevrolat, 1861
allows us to propose the present synonymy. The examined type specimens of both species names are deposited, respectively, in OXUM and BMNH .

The names of varieties proposed for
Elaphidion elegans
by
Chevrolat ( 1861 )
, viz
var. hirsutum
,
var. jocosum
, and
var. puberulum
, were not expressely given infrasubspecific rank, nor does the content of the work of Chevrolat indicate that the author refers to varieties as infrasubspecific entities. Therefore, in accordance with Article 45.6. 4 of the International Code of
Zoological Nomenclature ( ICZN , 1999 )
, these names must be deemed as of subspecific category and thus available. On the other hand, we consider these names invalid and synonyms of
Centrocerum variatum
, judging the differences noted by Chevrolat as intraspecific variation of this species and not as indication of the existence of more than one taxon.

Type specimens examined.

Newman, 1841
